column2: the hallucinations have stopped
column3: but now I have to deal with the tremors
column4: constant sweats and the problems of shaking all the time and knowing that I can't hold onto anything without dropping it
column5: let alone being able to stand up without falling down
column6: the tremors can be so bad that I am afraid to drive anymore and I have only been taking this med for the second time for about 2 weeks now
column7: the first time wasn't as bad as it is this time.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months$5$5$5$I have been using lithium for abouta month now. What a difference this has made for me. Mania calmed
column3: depression lifted. I am able to get along with others now. I have not expirenced any weight gain or dizziness
column4: or confusion. I have had an occasional light tremmor
column5: similar to having too much coffee. Over all this medication has been totally worth any side effects. My mind is much quiter now. What a difference. I wish I could have had this diagonsis 15 years ago.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years$5$3$5$"the only problem I have with lithium is the weight gain the inpending heart arithmia and the edema that it seems nothing helps but your in a state of mind that everyone loves so what do you do. you continue to take it and your body suffers but your mind is great.

column1: so what is the answer I don't think I know anymore. all the newer drugs I can't take. "

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer) $4$2$5$there have been a few times over the last 6-10 mo.s when lithium has worked for me. I believe that this infrequency is due to my negligence of my diet - more specifically
column3: my caffeine intake is generally considerably higher than it should be - both ideally & according to my Dr.which - if I'm understanding correctly - causes the lithium to be flushed through my system
column4: & ultimately renders me unable to reap the full benefit of this prescription. I will be pleased if my prescriber agrees to let me try a different mood stabilizer at my next appt. with him.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer) $4$4$4$I have an extremely low salt diet and if I do not take salt tablets with lithium daily
column3: my mind and body go into a stupor
column4: I get lethargic
column5: very sleepy
column6: slurred speech. It's really bad but if you get really bad side effects like that
column7: see if your salt levels are low and try a salt tablet before you give lithium up completely. My moods feel level when I take it together and it was worth going through that to finally get relief. Hope it helps. (For providers: Lithium can cause hypokalemia and watching salt levels is just as important as checking liver and kidney function)

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer) $4$3$4$I am a 58 year old female that has been on Lithium for a year to control mania.  It has been effective.  I have experienced tremors and dizziness.  I have recently noticed that my hair has become thin and fragile and the skin on my arms bruises easily.  Has anyone else experienced this?  I have not gained weight.  I am considering switching medications if the hair thinning is related to my use of Lithium.

86$Reason for taking:Bipolar disorder$11/21/2011 8:43:21 AM$Reviewer: Julia, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Consumer) $4$3$4$I'm a 39 y.o. mom who's had Bipolar I disorder for roughly 12 years.  I have tried EVERY medication thrown at me (don't take Depakote unless you want to gain 50 pounds in 1 month!)
column2: because I was so desperate to return to normalcy.  I believe Lithium DOES work
column3: provided that you stringently regulate your diet.  Too much or too little caffeine
column4: salt
column5: water can unbalance you.  Take NO NSAIDs PERIOD
column6: unless you want your kidneys to shut down (happened to me).  I'm still trying to determine how to best treat a headache
column8: since I can't take any painkillers or cold medicine
column9: but there is no doubt this drug has eliminated 90-95% of my bipolar mania symptoms
column10: with no return yet to any type of depression.  ""Works for me!""

column2: 1x day "

column1: 89$Reason for taking:Bipolar disorder$9/14/2011 2:23:13 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer) $5$5$3$Although you have to be at a theraputic dosage to get the full effect and you have to get bloodwork done periodically (which can be annoying and sometimes scary) it is a great drug from many years ago and remains the gold standard in treatment for bipolar disorder.  I feel that it has helped me with my mania side and also my depression. It can have bad side-effects
column2: but what medication doesn't?  The range that you need from Lithium carbonate can range from 300-1800mg so don't be discouraged if it is not working at a lower dose.
55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Consumer) $1$1$1$Took Lithium before I went to bed
column3: and the next morning I had severe problems with balance and the ability to walk
column4: and severe confusion.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Consumer) $5$5$5$I have been on lithium carbonate since 2007 for bipolar disorder and it has been extremely helpful and easy to take. I have noticed a difference from when I was untreated and it is amazing!

column1: 94$Reason for taking:Other$4/2/2011 8:38:37 AM$Reviewer:  (Consumer) $1$1$1$"This ""dietary supplement"" is extremely dangerous. I took this because I thought it was ""safe"" and ""all-natural"". I found out information about it through the internet thinking I could trust people. Boy was I wrong. There is misleading information everywhere. Most people are just trying to make a buck by selling this stuff when it's actually extremely dangerous and toxic (especially to the nervous system). Stay away please! Dietary supplements are unfortunately very unregulated by the FDA or for any levels of safety. Companies can put whatever ingredients they want into products. Stay away from products bought on the internet
column2: products that are claimed to be miracles
column3: and products that have any form of heavy metal in them. (Lithium IS a heavy metal.) Go to your doctor. Tell him/her your problem
column4: or find a new better doctor
column5: one that is trustworthy. DO NOT TAKE THIS PRODUCT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES. THIS PRODUCT=UNREGULATED
column6: DANGEROUS. Thank you. I sincerely hope that people listen. I personally was poisoned by a product like this
column7: and I don't want others to suffer. Please heed my warning."

97$Reason for taking:Schizophrenia$3/7/2011 3:55:04 AM$Reviewer: $1$1$1$"I took lithium orotate because I was told that it was ""safe"" and ""all natural"". This ""dietary supplement"" (which is completely unregulated) poisoned me and destroyed my life. The ""supplement"" attacked my central nervous system and poisoned my body. These supplements are sold by greedy people and witch doctors who are tricking innocent people and taking advantage of the lack of regulation on ""dietary supplements""
column2: in order to make money. Stay away from these tainted "" dietary supplements"". Dietary supplements in America have been found to have prescription drugs
column3: heavy metals
column4: and illegal substances. These unregulated ""supplements"" are extremely unsafe and unregulated. The companies selling these products operate in order to trick consumers or to push their snake oil onto innocent people. Often times they put up various websites touting their products or put up phony positive reviews of their ""dietary supplements"" to lure in consumers. They give off the impression that the ""supplements"" that they are selling are safer and a better alternative to mainstream medicine. In some cases this may be true
column5: but too often this unregulated medicine is much more dangerous. These companies
column6: under current law
column7: are not required to prove that their products are safe before selling them to consumers. The FDA doesn't even have the authority to remove products from the shelves unless they have huge amount of deaths or injuries reported. They do not currently have the authority to act before an incident strikes. Be wary
column10: unsafe ""dietary supplements"" (especially the ones containing lithium). Please understand. This is a legitimate issue and I want to help protect other innocent people. We need more regulation
column13: and responsibility. Thank you so much! I sincerely hope that my voice is heard."

117$Reason for taking:Depression$7/6/2009 8:00:01 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Consumer) $1$1$1$I was diagnosed with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder and my physician told me that Lithium would help me sleep.  He had me on 900 milligrams at night.  What a nightmare.  Even though I was able to sleep
column2: the side effects were impossible to live with.  The tremors were constant
column3: and once I slowly decreased and eventually stopped taking lithium
column4: all the tremors stopped and now I am taking 5-htp which is way better than wellbutrin
column5: and now looking at other supplement alternatives for staying focused and relieving some of the panic attacks.  I have found that the actual medicines do more harm to your body then the Vitamin Supplements
